name: Pennyland House B&B

reviews.text: When assessing accommodation I always try to be honest . What clearly comes out in all previous reviews of Pennyland is the warm and courteous welcome given by the owners . Carol, what a star , we arrived by train she picked us up and even took us to the fish shop for some supper, when we arrived at her house she supplied tea and bread and butter (at no cost) now that's what I call service. The breakfast was excellent . On our departure her husband drove us to the station ,to me way beyond the call of duty. The whole experience even though it was far too short was great , give it a try I'm sure you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Heaven in Scotland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't hesitate. The St. Andrew's suite is gorgeous. I've stayed at 5-star hotels that couldn't compete with the bathroom in this wonderful room. Everything in this house is well chosen and well placed. The breakfast room was beautiful and the food, exactly as ordered. We wanted to spend the next night there but the B&B was fully booked but Carol took the time to find us a place to stay in another B&B. You won't be disappointed if you book this B&B. Book early.
reviews.title: Best B&B Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our first night at Pennylands on the strength of the Tripadvisor rating, so so enjoyed the place but more especially the wonderful people that we booked two more nights on our return from the Orkneys, and then one more a week later after completing our tour of the Highlands. Coming in on the last night really felt like coming home, with cheery welcomes all round, and leaving the next morning felt like leaving home... we wanted to cry and beg to be allowed to stay forever!
reviews.title: More than a home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very comfortable, the breakfasts excellent, and come with free advice regarding the local points of interest. Raymond directed us to some really interesting places that we would never have discovered from a guide book. Location is excellent, right on the water, on the outskirts on Thurso but within easy and pleasant walking distance of the town and its restaurants.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only quibble would be with the poor WiFi: I had to sit on the lowest step, two floors down from our room, in order to get any reception. However, Carol is aware this is a problem, and when we were there was researching WiFi extenders so the problem is probably fixed by now.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Pennyland as a couple on 17/09/2013. From the moment of arrival until we departed our stay was fantastic. Pennyland is the beautiful home of Carol and Raymond who were both extremely warm and welcoming hosts, and all the reviews do not exaggerate when they say you arrive a guest and leave a friend. The room we had overlooking the sea was fantastic, and the décor was truly beautiful. The room was really spacious with everything you would wish for too make your stay comfortable. Breakfast was fantastic, and if you ever wish to stay in Thurso I truely recommend that you choose Pennyland house.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We echo everything that's already be said. This is a fantastic B&B run by two of the nicest people, Carol and Raymond really go the extra mile to make sure your stay is the best it can be. Pennyland is spotlessly clean, our 'Carnoustie' room was comfortable and modern and the selection at breakfast is superb. We travelled to Thurso to eat at the Captains Galley in Scrabster (a must do whilst you're in the area) and Raymond very kindly drove us to the restaurant. We will be recommending Pennyland to everyone we know travelling to Thurso.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed three nights with Carol and Raymond at Pennyland Bed and Breakfast overlooking the Pentland Firth and the Orkneys. Fantastic position and superb standard of accommodation. Lovely welcome and great breakfast. Raymond and Carol go out of their way to make your stay memorable. Well knowledgeable about the local surroundings and will make sure you do not miss any of the places to visit. We will be back !!!
reviews.title: Superb Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Carole and Raymond are the perfect hosts in the perfect location with the perfect accommodation. Great rooms, adequate parking, fantastic house, the best breakfasts in Scotland. They have a fantastic patio on their garden where you can sit and sip some wine. Carol will give you glasses. We even got a bowl of olives and some munchies. They are always on hand with a smile, a helpful tip and it was just like being at home. I can categorically state that in all my travels this was the best B&B we have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: What can I say that has not been said. Just go there will you!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've never written a trip advisor review before but just had to confirm that we found all the previous reviews to be accurate and we too had a very pleasant stay at Pennyland House. We had travelled by train and only stayed one night but will certainly return. Scrabster ferry terminal can be seen from the hotel and it's only an 8 minute casual walk in the other direction along the flat seafront road to the town centre. While chatting to Raymond after breakfast he very kindly offered to take us to Dunnet as we wanted to see the Caravan Club site and he also went a bit further on to let us, and another guest with us, see Dunnet Head - the most northerly point of UK. The other guest, from USA, was also catching a train so he dropped all three of us off at the station. Excellent service, thanks for being our very knowledgeable tour guide Raymond.
reviews.title: It's all true.
A fantastic find!
reviews.text: We booked this b&b after reading rave reviews on trip advisor & it did not let us down. From the warm welcome to the spacious and comfortable room (Loch Lomond) and the fabulous breakfast, not to mention the lovely homemade shortbread, this was truly a home from home. Topped off by the fact my husband realised he went to school with Carol in a previous life! Cannot recommend highly enough & hope to return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed one night with a couple of friends in Pennyland House B&B. It was one of the most beautiful b&b we stayed in. Carol and her husband were so nice, helpful and made the 4 of us feel at home. The rooms were beautiful, big and really comfortable. The bed was amazing, and so was the bathroom. DVD player and a large choice of DVD are available for all rooms.
reviews.title: Just one night... it was definitely a too short stay

reviews.text: The breakfast was delicious with lots of choice and even fresh fruits prepared and cut for all of us.
reviews.title: Everything about this place is superb!

reviews.text: The situation is great (with beautiful views on the sea from some of the rooms), and at walking distance (10-15min) from pubs and restaurant of the town centre. Carol gave us really good advice for dinner.
reviews.title: Very nice accommodations, excellent service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hope we ll saty here again!
reviews.title: If you're going to thurso then stay here.

reviews.text: Lovely place to stay in a good location close to Thurso. Clean, comfortable and spacious. Breakfast was plentiful and varied. Friendly hosts who obviously know how to look after there guests. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Pennyland House is simply wonderful. Rooms, clean comfortable, beautifully furnished. Carol and Raymond work so hard to ensure their guests have a comfortable stay. There is just nothing they could do to improve my stay. Stayed on business for six nights, will be back!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like others we only spent one night here on the way to Orkney and Carol was incredibly friendly and helpful. The room and its facilities were excellent as was the breakfast, served by very friendly and efficient staff. Knowing that we were returning to Thurso for a week elsewhere in self catering Carol still offered lots of advice for our return including an open door for any advice (and a wee cup of tea!). Like other TA contributors, we would definitely recommend this B&B.
reviews.title: Can't fault this brilliant place

reviews.text: PS Selected fitness centre rating in error!
reviews.title: Rave review here too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely comfortable bed and breakfast...passionate and welcoming hosts who could not do enough. The location is good, easy to find if you don't put the post code into GPS. Breakfast was delicious too. Home away from home.....just loved the stay
reviews.title: Highly recommended

description: Pennyland House is located on the edge of Thurso in a quiet, but convenient location and boasts wonderful views of the Orkney Islands, Dunnet Head, Scrabster and Thurso Bay. It is a three story building dating back over two hundred years. Built in 1780 it is historically noted for being the birthplace of Sir William Alexander Smith, the founder of the Boys Brigade. Over the past few years we have sympathetically renovated this historic building and turned it into a comfortable and interesting bed and breakfast for our guests. Although not yet rated, we are confident that you will not be disappointed with the quality and service during your stay with us. We have enjoyed putting our personal stamp on Pennyland House and have tried to reflect what we believe people want in a 'home from home'.
